textContent:
One way to think about the point of living is to think about our consciousness as our opportunity to be present with the here and now.

Present meaning aware of reality. Aware of the sensations being experienced. Aware of what is happening here. Without feelings of fear and hope. Present meaning aware of the here and now without adulterating it with fear and hope.

There is a role for fear and a role for hope when action is required, but only when action is required. 

...Both place the focus of the mind on the I, me, self, ego. In doing so, both weaken the connection with the present reality and awareness of the here and now...

In the present, aware of reality, aware of the way the universe is, not trying to understand it, not trying to explain it, but feeling it with every sense available, is the natural state of communion with the infinite energy of the universe. The energy that creates the I and conversely destroys it. Being aware of this energy in the here and now means feelings of fear and hope don't exist. 

The suffering (or avoodance of) and the joy  (or seeking of) therefore cannot be the actual point of existence. The experience of both point to a gap, break or obstacle in the way of being present in reality - the here and now. 

In this way the point of what we do - education, work, religion, food, shelter, recreation, leisure, etc. cannot satisfy if done for the avoidance of suffering or seeking of pleasure. 

While it feels right to say the point of exercise & training is to be able to climb a  mountain or lose weight this is actually a self defeating goal because it's unsustainable. Rather, if the point of exercising is to access the mountains (via strength or weight loss) to experience their communion with the world then it is sustainable. It's become about the journey and not about the destination (i.e. the point is to enjoy the mountain experience in the first place, not simply the summit). 

The point of what we do can be thought of as enabling the conditions for being present in the here and now. Every activity has the potential to enable communion with the present.

Ratchet of Enlightenment 
- Being in harmony with the energy of the universe 
- Thinking about being in harmony with the energy of the universe. 
- Speaking about being in harmony with the energy of the universe 
- Acting in harmony with the energy of the universe
